intro: Lomatium caruifolium, commonly known as western lomatium, is a perennial herb native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its fern-like leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and meadows. It has a taproot system and produces small, winged fruits that are dispersed by wind. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
